required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation on Oxidative Stress, Antioxidant Capacity, Inflammatory Responses, Fatigue Elimination, and Exercise Performance in Athletes
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Coenzyme Q10 Supplementation on Oxidative Stress, Antioxidant Capacity, Inflammatory Responses, Fatigue Elimination, and Exercise Performance in Athletes From Different Sports: Cross-sectional, Interventional, and Follow-up Studies

brief_summary.textblock: The aims of the study are 1) to compare the differences in plasma coenzyme Q10, oxidative stress, antioxidant capacity, muscle impairment, fatigue recovery, and inflammation and exercise performances in athletes (i.e., soccer, and taekwondo players) and healthy non-athletes; 2) to investigate the relationship between plasma coenzyme Q10, oxidative stress, antioxidant capacity, muscle impairment, fatigue recovery, and inflammation and exercise performances; 3) to explore the influence on plasma coenzyme Q10, oxidative stress, antioxidant capacity, muscle impairment, fatigue recovery, and inflammation and exercise performances after 12 weeks of coenzyme Q10 intervention (150 mg/day and 300 mg/day).

detailed_description.textblock: The long-term high-amount and -intensity exercise training could cause oxidative damage, muscle impairment, inflammation and exercise fatigue to athletes easily. Such above conditions will affect the exercise performances and health of athletes. The aims of the study are 1) to compare the differences in plasma coenzyme Q10, oxidative stress, antioxidant capacity, muscle impairment, fatigue recovery, and inflammation and exercise performances in athletes (i.e., soccer, and taekwondo players) and healthy non-athletes; 2) to investigate the relationship between plasma coenzyme Q10, oxidative stress, antioxidant capacity, muscle impairment, fatigue recovery, and inflammation and exercise performances; 3) to explore the influence on plasma coenzyme Q10, oxidative stress, antioxidant capacity, muscle impairment, fatigue recovery, and inflammation and exercise performances after 12 weeks of coenzyme Q10 intervention (150 mg/day and 300 mg/day). Eventually, these results of this study can provide the information for the known to improve the oxidative stress, anti-oxidation and inflammation internal to the bodies of athletes for various competitions. As a consequence, the athletic performances can be further enhanced.

primary_outcome.description: MDA (micromol/L) will measure by thiobarbituric acid reacting substance.

secondary_outcome.description: Total antioxidant capacity (TAC) was measured by a Trolox equivalent antioxidant capacity assay in serum and erythrocytes.
serum CK will measure by enzymatic method.
serum LDH will measure by enzymatic method.
1RM measurements will report in kilograms for data analysis.
HbA1C will measure by an automated glycated hemoglobin analyzer
insulin will measure by an automated chemistry analyzer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Athletes (soccer and taekwondo players)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Antioxidant vitamins users
- Statins or Aspirin therapy.
